result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Kearns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------

No contact with any one under age of 16 except for incidental.
-------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher M Kearns in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher M Kearns in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Denying Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Unconstitutional Search

9:31 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher M Kearns in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger. 
Matter is before the Court today on the Defendant's Motion.  
Court will not deal with the minimum mandatory prison sentence issue as this matter is currently on appeal in another case.
Attorney Lettenberger is not necessarily agreeing that this is a Franks Motion.  
Discussion between Court and Attorney Lettenberger as to clarification of his Motion.  
9:39 a.m.  Response by Attorney Johnson.  
9:42 a.m.  Continued argument by Attorney Lettenberger and Attorney Johnson.  
9:50 a.m.  Detective Michael Lambert is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Attorney Johnson.  
9:53 a.m.  Cross exam by Attorney Lettenberger.  

Exhibit #1 marked and identified as Search Warrant and Affidavit

10:07 a.m.  Redirect by Attorney Johnson.  
10:07 a.m.  Follow up questions by Attorney Lettenberger.  
10:08 a.m.  Witness excused
Exhibit #1 is offered and received into evidence.

10:08 a.m.  Argument by Attorney Lettenberger.  
10:13 a.m.  Argument by Attorney Johnson.  

10:17 a.m.  Court makes findings that the standard in Franks has not been met.  
Court believes there is sufficient infomation to constitute probable cause.  
Court denies defendant's Motion.  
Court asks Attorney Lettenberger to prepare an Order.  
Response by Attorney Lettenberger requesting that an Order not be prepared until after the Decision in the Appeal case.  
Court asks that the Order be submitted within a week and the Court will further consider Attorney Lettenberger's request.  
10:22 a.m.  Court in recess.  


  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher M Kearns in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher M Kearns in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before Court for arraignment.  Attorney Lettenberger advises he has gone over the charges and penalties with his client and the Defendant wishes to stand mute.  Court enters a not guilty plea on the Defendant's behalf.  Attorney Lettenberger advises that he will be filing motions.  Court schedules a status hearing and sets the motion deadline for the same date as the status conference.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

**AMENDMENT 08-04-2015 - CASH BOND AMENDED DOWN TO $2500.00. BALANCE TO BE REFUNDED TO PERSON WHO POSTED BOND. Defendant may possess a new phone with NO Internet Access**

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS. NOT TO USE ANY DEVICES WITH INTERNET ACCESS. NO USE OF ANY COMPUTER. NO INTERNET ACCESS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
